connector.common

Class XmlUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • connector.common.XmlUtil

  • public class XmlUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for creating and parsing XML.

      • getXpathExpression

        public static javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpression getXpathExpression(java.lang.String xpathExpr,
                                                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> namespaceMappings)
                                                          throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
        Prepares an XPathExpression object using the supplied XPath expression and the namespace mappings.

        namespaceMappings should contain all non-standard XML namespaces which may exist in the XML for correct parsing using XPath.

        Parameters:
        xpathExpr - string representation of XPath expression
        namespaceMappings - namespace mappings, if any, can be null
        Returns:
        an XPathExpression object
        Throws:
        javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException

        namespaceMappings should contain all non-standard XML namespaces which may exist in the XML for correct parsing using XPath.

        Parameters:
        namespaceMappings - namespace mappings, if any, can be null
        Returns:

      • escapeAttribute

        public static void escapeAttribute(java.lang.StringBuilder b,
                                   java.lang.String s)
        Escape the given attribute and store it in the given StringBuffer. ignore - !! TODO: need to pass in the delimiter being used so we know which one to escape and which to preserve.

      • escapeAttribute

        public static void escapeAttribute(java.io.Writer f,
                                   java.lang.String s)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Variant for Writers.

        ignore - As always happens, some zealous refactorer is going to look at this someday, declare "it sucks" and launch off into an over-engineered blowout that lets us stream XML into anything with a hole. Just remember that this is an "inner loop" utility, we should not be generating garbage in here. Due to the inconsistent java.io classes, this makes it almost impossible to do without duplication. If we do anything we define our own stream interface with implementations built on various shards of java.io.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • unescapeAttribute

        public static java.lang.String unescapeAttribute(java.lang.String s)
        Unescape an XML attribute - this is the inverse of escapeAttribute().

      • escapeContent

        public static void escapeContent(java.lang.StringBuilder b,
                                 java.lang.String s)
        Differs from escapeAttribute in that we don't escape quotes. Also handles the ]]> CDATA ending sequence. Technically we should be doing that for attributes but we never try to store escaped XML in attribute content.

        ignore - NOTE: Originally we escaped newlines, returns, and tabs, but this made it impossible to edit Rule source because all formatting was lost. These characters are all valid in element content so I'm not sure why we escaped them. If you think you need to put the escaping back, discuss with the team, we may need a way for XMLProperty to declare ecaping style.

      • escapeContent

        public static java.lang.String escapeContent(java.lang.String s)
        Escape the given element content.

      • escapeContent

        public static void escapeContent(java.io.Writer f,
                                 java.lang.String s)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Escape the given element content and stream it to a Writer.

        ignore - A variant that streams to a file. It's too bad that we have to duplicate this but it seems silly to create wrapper garbage around StringBuilder just so we can share the guts.

        As always happens, some zealous refactorer is going to look at this someday, declare "it sucks" and launch off into an over-engineered blowout that lets us stream XML into anything with a hole. Just remember that this is an "inner loop" utility, we should not be generating garbage in here. Due to the inconsistent java.io classes, this makes it almost impossible to do without duplication. If we do anything we define our own stream interface with implementations built on various shards of java.io.

        See escapeContent(StringBuilder, String) for more information about what we need to escape.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isXmlChar

        public static boolean isXmlChar(char ch)
        Return whether the given character is an XML char.

      • addContent

        public static void addContent(java.lang.StringBuilder b,
                              java.lang.Object o)
        Replaces special characters in a string with XML character entities. The characters replaced are '&' and '<'. This should be when building strings intended to be the values of XML attributes or XML element content.

      • addAttribute

        public static void addAttribute(java.lang.StringBuilder b,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String value)
        Adds an attribute name and value to a string buffer.

        Performs any necessary escaping on the value. This should be used when you're building the XML for something, and its possible for an attribute value to have any of the characters &, ', or "

      • extractNamespaces

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> extractNamespaces(java.lang.String xmlContent)
        Extracts and prepares namespace prefix to namespace URI mappings
        Parameters:
        xmlContent - XML content to extract namespace information from
        Returns:
        Map containing keys as namespace prefix and namespace URI as corresponding values
